title: Local divers spoilt for choice
text:
Local divers spoilt for choice 25th Sep 2015 11:50 AM Fly by helicopter to South Solitary Island which is located 18kms from Coffs Harbour, NSW. The lighthouse island is normally closed to the public. Popular Stories Local Real Estate Cars For Sale 
IN A FEW weeks time a group of keen local divers is heading south over the border to dive North Solitary Island. 
North Solitary Island is one of the largest islands off the New South Wales coast. 
It lies north-east of Coffs Harbour and east south east of Wooli, a small sleepy fishing hamlet. 
The group plans to do four dives over two days staying two nights at Wooli. 
There are a number of popular dive sites around the island including Anemone Bay. 
This is a sheltered inlet with boulders strewn around the bottom. 
There are numerous anemone fish to be seen as well as stingrays, turtles and cowrie shells amongst the hard and soft corals. 
Other sites include The Canyons, The Step and the Bubble Caves. Diving depths range from 10 metres down to 40 metres. 
Being in the temperate zone the water gets pretty cold but the divers will be well prepared with most wearing either dry suits or thick neoprene suits with hoods attached. diving
